Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Warehouse

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Warehouse
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class Warehouse
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
Class representing the actual warehouse in player board as an object made by a strongbox, three depots and two possible extra depots (depending on player's active leader effects).

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.util.Map<ResourceType,​java.lang.Integer> availableResources
    Map with all the resources available in warehouse, summing of those present into depots, strongbox and extra depots.
    private ExtraDepot[] extraDepots
    Array of two extra depots that are set to null until an extra depot effect becomes active
    private NormalDepot[] normalDepots
    Array with three instances of normal depot
    private Strongbox strongbox
    Instance of a strongbox

    Constructor Description

    Warehouse​(java.util.Map<ResourceType,​java.lang.Integer> availableResources, NormalDepot[] normalDepot, ExtraDepot[] extraDepot, Strongbox strongbox)  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addResourcesToDepot​(int depotIndex, ResourceType type, int num)
    Stores a non-negative amount of resource in a normal depot and updates available resources.
    void addResourcesToExtraDepot​(ResourceType type, int num)
    Stores a positive number of resources in an extra depot, found on the basis of which type of resource the player wants to store in it and updates available resources.
    void addResourcesToStrongbox​(java.util.Map<ResourceType,​java.lang.Integer> resources)
    Stores resources into the strongbox and updates available resources.
    int calcVictoryPointsWarehouse()
    This method calculates number of points gained summing all the resources in warehouse and dividing the result by five.
    boolean checkMoveFromExtraDepotToNormalDepot​(int extraDepotFrom, int occ, int depotTo)
    Boolean method called by turn controller to check if a move action can be performed from an extra depot to a normal one comparing number of occurrences and ensuring that the action is compliant with game rules.
    boolean checkMoveFromNormalDepotToExtraDepot​(int depotFrom, int occ, int extraDepotTo)
    Boolean method called by turn controller to check if a move action can be performed from a normal depot to an extra depot comparing number of occurrences and type of resources to be moved.
    boolean checkMoveFromNormalDepotToNormalDepot​(int depotFrom, int depotTo)
    Boolean method called by turn controller over player warehouse to check whether a move action from normal depot to another normal depot is possible or not on the basis of game rules.
    boolean checkResourceFromExtraDepot​(ResourceType type, int occ)
    Checks whether an extra depot has enough occurrences of a certain resource type.

    Boolean method that checks if the warehouse has a normal depot with a non-negative number of a certain resource type.

    • normalDepots

      private final NormalDepot[] normalDepots
      Array with three instances of normal depot

    • extraDepots

      private final ExtraDepot[] extraDepots
      Array of two extra depots that are set to null until an extra depot effect becomes active
      See Also:
      LeaderEffect

  • Method Details

    • initializeExtraDepot

      public void initializeExtraDepot​(ResourceType resourceType)
      Initializes an extra depot
      Parameters:
      resourceType - the immutable resource that can be stored in the extra depot
      See Also:
      ExtraDepot

    • addResourcesToStrongbox

      public void addResourcesToStrongbox​(java.util.Map<ResourceType,​java.lang.Integer> resources)
      Stores resources into the strongbox and updates available resources.
      Parameters:
      resources - map of resources with non-negative occurrences that have to be stored.

    • addResourcesToDepot

      public void addResourcesToDepot​(int depotIndex, ResourceType type, int num) throws DepotOutOfBoundsException, IncompatibleResourceTypeException
      Stores a non-negative amount of resource in a normal depot and updates available resources.
      Parameters:
      depotIndex - index of the required normal depot.
      type - kind of resource that has to be stored.
      num - occurrences to be stored.
      Throws:
      DepotOutOfBoundsException - if this addition is not compliant with normal depot size
      IncompatibleResourceTypeException - if we're attempting to add a type of resource different from the one that is already stored.

    • addResourcesToExtraDepot

      public void addResourcesToExtraDepot​(ResourceType type, int num) throws DepotOutOfBoundsException, DepotNotFoundException
      Stores a positive number of resources in an extra depot, found on the basis of which type of resource the player wants to store in it and updates available resources.
      Parameters:
      type - type of resource to be stored.
      num - positive number of occurrences to be stored.
      Throws:
      DepotOutOfBoundsException - if number of occurrences exceed the size of extra depot or it becomes negative.
      DepotNotFoundException - if there is no extra depot available to store required type of resource.

    • takeResourceFromNormalDepot

      public void takeResourceFromNormalDepot​(ResourceType type, int occ) throws DepotNotFoundException, DepotOutOfBoundsException
      Removes a non-negative number of occurrences from a normal depot found on the basis of which type of resource the player requires, at the end updates available resources.
      Parameters:
      type - type of resource to be removed.
      occ - number of resource to be removed.
      Throws:
      DepotNotFoundException - if there's no normal depot associated to the kind of resource required.
      DepotOutOfBoundsException - if number of occurrences becomes negative.

    • takeResourcesFromStrongbox

      public void takeResourcesFromStrongbox​(java.util.Map<ResourceType,​java.lang.Integer> occurrences) throws StrongboxOutOfBoundException
      Removes a map of non-negative occurrences from the strongbox and updates available resources.
      Parameters:
      occurrences - map containing resources to be removed.
      Throws:
      StrongboxOutOfBoundException - if at least of one number of occurrence of resource in the strongbox becomes negative.

    • takeResourceFromExtraDepot

      public void takeResourceFromExtraDepot​(ResourceType type, int occ) throws DepotNotFoundException, DepotOutOfBoundsException
      Removes a non-negative number of occurrences from an extra depot found on the basis of resource type chosen, at the end updates available resources.
      Parameters:
      type - type of resource to be removed.
      occ - number of resource to be removed.
      Throws:
      DepotNotFoundException - if there is no extra depot that contains required type of resource.
      DepotOutOfBoundsException - if number of occurrences in extra depot becomes negative.

    • checkResources

      public boolean checkResources​(java.util.Map<ResourceType,​java.lang.Integer> neededResources)
      Boolean method that checks if the player has enough resources to perform a certain action by comparing map of needed resources with available ones.
      Parameters:
      neededResources - resources needed to do an action.
      Returns:
      the result of the comparison.

    • checkResourceFromNormalDepot

      public boolean checkResourceFromNormalDepot​(ResourceType type, int occ)
      Boolean method that checks if the warehouse has a normal depot with a non-negative number of a certain resource type.
      Parameters:
      type - resource type required.
      occ - number of resource type required.
      Returns:
      the result of the check.

    • checkResourceFromStrongBox

      public boolean checkResourceFromStrongBox​(ResourceType type, int occ)
      Boolean method that checks if strongbox has enough occurrences of a certain resource type.
      Parameters:
      type - resource type required.
      occ - number of occurrences.
      Returns:
      the result of the check.

    • checkResourceFromExtraDepot

      public boolean checkResourceFromExtraDepot​(ResourceType type, int occ)
      Checks whether an extra depot has enough occurrences of a certain resource type.
      Parameters:
      type - resource type required.
      occ - number of occurrences.
      Returns:
      the result of the check.

    • checkMoveFromNormalDepotToNormalDepot

      public boolean checkMoveFromNormalDepotToNormalDepot​(int depotFrom, int depotTo)
      Boolean method called by turn controller over player warehouse to check whether a move action from normal depot to another normal depot is possible or not on the basis of game rules.
      Parameters:
      depotFrom - index of starting normal depot.
      depotTo - index of destination normal depot.
      Returns:
      the result of the check.

    • checkMoveFromNormalDepotToExtraDepot

      public boolean checkMoveFromNormalDepotToExtraDepot​(int depotFrom, int occ, int extraDepotTo)
      Boolean method called by turn controller to check if a move action can be performed from a normal depot to an extra depot comparing number of occurrences and type of resources to be moved.
      Parameters:
      depotFrom - index of starting normal depot.
      occ - number of occurrences that have to be moved.
      extraDepotTo - index of extra depot destination.
      Returns:
      the result of the check.

    • checkMoveFromExtraDepotToNormalDepot

      public boolean checkMoveFromExtraDepotToNormalDepot​(int extraDepotFrom, int occ, int depotTo)
      Boolean method called by turn controller to check if a move action can be performed from an extra depot to a normal one comparing number of occurrences and ensuring that the action is compliant with game rules.
      Parameters:
      extraDepotFrom - index of starting extra depot.
      occ - number of occurrences that have to be moved.
      depotTo - index of normal depot destination.
      Returns:
      the result of the check.

    • moveFromNormalDepotToNormalDepot

      public void moveFromNormalDepotToNormalDepot​(int depotFrom, int depotTo)
      Moves resources from a normal depot to another normal depot. It switches the number of occurrences and the resource type creating two new instances of normal depots. Each time this method is called it creates a new instances for depots involved into the move.
      Parameters:
      depotFrom - index of starting normal depot
      depotTo - index of destination normal depot.
      See Also:
      MoveFromNormalToNormalAction

    • moveFromNormalDepotToExtraDepot

      public void moveFromNormalDepotToExtraDepot​(int depotFrom, int occ, int extraDepotTo)
      Moves resources from a normal depot to an extra one. Each time this method is called it creates a new instances for depots involved into the move.
      Parameters:
      depotFrom - index of normal depot from which the resources are moved.
      occ - number of occurrences to be moved.
      extraDepotTo - index of extra depot destination for the resources.
      See Also:
      MoveFromNormalToExtraAction

    • moveFromExtraDepotToNormalDepot

      public void moveFromExtraDepotToNormalDepot​(int extraDepotFrom, int occ, int depotTo)
      Moves resources from an extra depot to a normal one. Each time this method is called it creates a new instances for depots involved into the move.
      Parameters:
      extraDepotFrom - index of extra depot from which the resources are moved.
      occ - number of occurrences to be moved.
      depotTo - index of normal depot destination for the resources.
      See Also:
      MoveFromExtraToNormalAction

    • findNormalDepotByResourceType

      public int findNormalDepotByResourceType​(ResourceType type) throws DepotNotFoundException
      Method that searches for a normal depot given a resource type.
      Parameters:
      type - resource type that has to be linked to extra depot to find.
      Returns:
      index of the normal depot (if present).
      Throws:
      DepotNotFoundException - if the player doesn't have any normal depot with the required resource type

    • findExtraDepotByResourceType

      public int findExtraDepotByResourceType​(ResourceType type) throws DepotNotFoundException
      Method that searches for an extra depot given a resource type.
      Parameters:
      type - resource type that has to be linked to extra depot to find.
      Returns:
      index of extra depot (if present).
      Throws:
      DepotNotFoundException - if the player doesn't have any extra depot with the required resource type

    • calcVictoryPointsWarehouse

      public int calcVictoryPointsWarehouse()
      This method calculates number of points gained summing all the resources in warehouse and dividing the result by five.
      Returns:
      the number of points.

    • isValidEditing

      private boolean isValidEditing​(ResourceType resourceType, int depotTo)
      This method checks whether an action over normal depots breaks game rules, in particular way it ensures that at most one normal depot contains a particular type of resource.
      Parameters:
      resourceType - type of resource.
      depotTo - index of the depot to be edited.
      Returns:
      the result of the check.

    • updateAvailableResources

      private void updateAvailableResources()
      Updates map representing all the resources available in warehouse. It collects them starting from strongbox and then for each one sums occurrences coming from depots with the previous value.

    • getNormalDepots

      public java.util.List<NormalDepot> getNormalDepots()

    • getExtraDepots

      public java.util.List<ExtraDepot> getExtraDepots()

      public ExtraDepot[] getterUnsafeExtraDepots()
      Unsafe getter method used for test purposes only.

    • getReducedVersion

      public ReducedWarehouse getReducedVersion()

    • getAvailableResources

      public java.util.Map<ResourceType,​java.lang.Integer> getAvailableResources()
      Unsafe getter method used for test purposes only.

    • getResourcesInStrongbox

      public java.util.List<Pair<ResourceType,​java.lang.Integer>> getResourcesInStrongbox()
      Returns:
      for each Resource Type, the number of occurrences present in the strongbox.
